Detailed Description

A collection of linear mappings.

Function Documentation

◆ skew() [1/2]

double xdsp::skew::skew ( double x,
double skew )
inline

Skew a value.
https://www.desmos.com/calculator/i2fxrdshdi
(Maps a value from [0.0 to 1.0] to [0.0 to 1.0])

This can be used give a control more resolution in a certain range.
The idea is to skew a normalized control value before denormalizing,
offsetting the distribution.

skew = 1.0 has no effect
skew in [0.0, 1.0) gives more resolution in the lower range
skew in (1.0, INF) gives more resolution in the upper range

Parameters
xValue in [0.0, 1.0]
skewSkew factor
Returns
Skewed value in [0.0, 1.0]

Definition at line 35 of file skew.h.

35{ return pow(x, 1.0 / skew); }

◆ unskew() [2/2]

float xdsp::skew::unskew ( float x,
float skew )
inline

Unskew a value.
https://www.desmos.com/calculator/i2fxrdshdi.

Reverses the effect of skewing a value with given skew factor.

Parameters
xSkewed value in [0.0, 1.0]
skewSkew factor
Returns
Unskewed value in [0.0, 1.0]
